title.narrative: PREVENT AND RESPOND TO HARMFUL PRACTICES AND VIOLENCE AGAINST GIRLS AND BOYS

description.narrative: Community members and leaders are better able to prevent and respond to harmful practices and violence against girls and boys within their communities., which contributes to Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: CHILD PROTECTION outcome: Girls and boys vulnerable and exposed to violence, abuse and exploitation are better protected by institutional (formal and informal) and legislative frameworks which include services and systems.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Community members and leaders are better able to prevent and respond to harmful practices and violence against girls and boyswithin their communities.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF doubled its efforts to reach vulnerable children, families, and communities to prevent violence, harmful practices and strengthen community structures. 2,156,692, 60% female key influential community members including parents, religious leaders, teachers, and adolescents gained deeper understanding of child’s rights, child protection, gender norms and created collective community responses towards negative social norms including child marriage and child labour. A total of 13,269 (49% girls) adolescents gained life skills and were empowered as change agents towards abandonment of child marriage and violence against children. Positive engagement with Taliban authorities initiated in 3 regions on child protection. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2022
